V.ii.3.C.3.a
.
Considering Direct SC for Obesity
Obesity per se is not a disease or injury for the purposes of
38 U.S.C 1110
and
38 U.S.C. 1131
and therefore may not be SC on a direct basis.
Obesity cannot qualify as an in-service event because it occurs over time and is based on various external and internal factors, as opposed to being a discrete incident or occurrence, or a series of discrete incidents or occurrences.
References
:  For more information on
considering SC for obesity, see
VAOPGCPREC 1-2017
, and
whether CAVC has jurisdiction to review Board of Veterans’ Appeals decisions that obesity and dysmetabolic syndrome are not disabilities for the purposes of 38 U.S.C. 1110, see
Larson v. McDonough
, 10 F.4th 1325 (Fed. Cir. 2021).
